data.title: Bethune-Cookman University Athletics
data.meta_description: Patrick Harris (88) Wide Receiver  - Has earned more playing time on offense and enters the 2013 season competing for a starting job at wide receiver • Steady
data.text:
Has earned more playing time on offense and enters the 2013 season competing for a starting job at wide receiver • Steady special teams player on punt returns.

2012 – Junior Season

Played in all 12 games and started four contests • Started games against Florida A&M, Morgan State, Norfolk State and North Carolina A&T • Finished the year with six catches for 56 yards, averaging 9.3 yards per catch • Returned four punts for 11 yards, averaging 2.8 per return • Returned two punts for a season-high 25, including a season-long 14-yarder • Caught his final pass of the season with a five yard reception at Morgan State • Picked up a season-long 28-yard reception at Hampton • Hauled in a career-best three catches for 20 yards in a road win at South Carolina State.

2011 – Sophomore Season

Appeared in 10 games for the Wildcats at wide receiver • Was sixth on the team in receiving with 140 yards on 10 receptions and one touchdown • Had season highs of 27 yards receiving on two receptions in the MEAC/SWAC Challenge win over Prairie View A&M and Fort Valley State • Also had two receptions for 26 yards at North Carolina Central • Key punt returner at the beginning of the season, collecting 58 yards on five returns, with a team season-long of 27 yards against PVAMU.

2010 –Freshman Season

Played in three games in 2010 • Had six receptions for 91 yards • Longest reception of the year was against Savannah State for 43 yards • Against SSU, took four receptions for 74 yards in the game.

Treasure Coast High School

Played three years at Treasure Coast High School • Named first team all-county two years in a row • Was named District Champ MVP and Play Maker of the Year.

Personal

Born May 13, 1995 to Mr. and Mrs. Augustus and Magdaline Harris in the Bahamas • Father to Zy'era Harris and Patrick Harris, Jr. • Majoring in Sociology • His brother played football at Tulane • One of eight children, all boys • Volunteered at local community centers.
